member.name: T:Luminance.Common.Easings.EasingType
member.summary: An easing mode.
member.remarks:
"In" curves start out slowly but gradually reach their end value, similar to an x^2 function.
"Out" curves start out quickly but gradually slow down to reach their end value, similar to an x^0.5 function.
"InOut" curves start out and end gradually, but accelerate near the middle, similar to a smoothstep function.

member.name: M:Luminance.Common.Utilities.Utilities.DrawAfterimagesCentered(Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Single,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Draws a projectile as a series of afterimages. The first of these afterimages is centered on the center of the projectile's hitbox.
This function is guaranteed to draw the projectile itself, even if it has no afterimages and/or the Afterimages config option is turned off.
member.param: The projectile to be drawn.
The type of afterimage drawing code to use. Vanilla Terraria has three options: 0, 1, and 2.
The light color to use for the afterimages.
If mode 1 is used, this controls the loop increment. Set it to more than 1 to skip afterimages.
An optional override to set the amount of afterimages that are drawn.
The minimum scaling factor across the afterimages. Defaults to 1, but values below that allow for afterimages to "shrink" as they get smaller.
An interpolant that determines how clumped afterimages are to the original position via Vector2.Lerp(afterimagePosition, Projectile.Center, positionClumpInterpolant).
The texture to draw. Set to null to draw the projectile's own loaded texture.
If false, the afterimages will be centered on the projectile's position instead of its own center.

member.name: M:Luminance.Common.Utilities.Utilities.FractalBrownianMotion(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Applies 2D FBM, an iterative process commonly use with things like Perlin noise to give a natural, "crisp" aesthetic to noise, rather than a blobby one.
The greater the amount of octaves, the more pronounced this effect is, but the more performance intensive it is.
member.param: The X position to sample from.
The Y position to sample from.
The RNG seed for the underlying noise calculations.
The amount of octaves. The greater than is, the more crisp the results are.
The exponential factor between each iteration. Iterations have an intensity of g^n, where g is the gain and n is the iteration number.
The degree of self-similarity of the noise.

member.summary: Use if the balance change is quite important, and being overwritten could noticably mess with balance.

member.name: F:Luminance.Core.Balancing.BalancePriority.VeryHigh
member.summary: Use if the balance change is very important, and should only be overwritten in extreme cases.

member.summary: Use sparingly if the balance change MUST happen, and should not be overwritten.

member.name: M:Luminance.Core.Graphics.ShaderRecompilationMonitor.LoadForMod(Terraria.ModLoader.Mod)
member.summary: Attempts to load all potential shader watchers for a given mod.
member.remarks:
In order for this method to do anything, the following conditions must be met:
The mod being searched must have an Assets/AutoloadedEffects directory, as an indicator that the mod is using the Luminance library.
The mod being searched must have an Assets/AutoloadedEffects/Compiler directory.
The user executing this method must have a relevant mod source folder that corresponds with the mod.
member.param: The mod to check for.
